intro: Hyperbaena glauciramis, commonly known as the blue-veined spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that often have a bluish or grayish hue. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-yellow, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Hyperbaena glauciramis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
